sentence.Network_en: The adage " Trade is better than aid " is clearly of great relevance to agriculture.
sentence.Network_cn: “ 贸易胜于援助, ” 这一格言对于农业显然是十分中肯的.

sentence.Network_en: But the old adage that men grow into office has not proved true in my experience.
sentence.Network_cn: 但是,根据我的经验,人们所谓的工作岗位造就人材这句古话并不正确.

sentence.Network_en: Answering probably an adage: The day fails the person wishes.
sentence.Network_cn: 或许正应了一句老话: 天不遂人愿.

derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 16th cent.: from French, from Latin adagium 'saying', based on an early form of aio 'I say'

entry.def: An adage is something which people often say and which expresses a general truth about some aspect of life.

example.ex: ...the old adage, 'Every baby brings its own love'.
example.tran: 那句古老的谚语，“每个婴儿生来就带着爱”

means.word_mean: 1. a condensed but memorable saying embodying some important fact of experience that is taken as true by many people

auth_sentence.content: Never has the adage if-it-aint-broke-don't-fix-it been more apt.
auth_sentence.res_content: Never has the adage if-it-aint-broke-don't-fix-it been more apt.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Never has the adage if-it-aint-broke-don't-fix-it been more apt.

auth_sentence.content: Logic would dictate the old adage of it-ain't-broke-don't fix-it.
auth_sentence.res_content: Logic would dictate the old adage of it-ain't-broke-don't fix-it.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Logic would dictate the old adage of it-ain't-broke-don't fix-it.

auth_sentence.content: The adage that familiarity breeds contempt may be all too apposite.
auth_sentence.res_content: The adage that familiarity breeds contempt may be all too apposite.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The adage that familiarity breeds contempt may be all too apposite.

sentences.en: Remember the old adage—buy cheap, buy twice!
sentences.cn: 记住那句俗语：便宜无好货。
